entry.title: Reland "Better handle web test artifact directory for Wptrunner"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 65710f289e80570a3f1bd9b3c31d6671acbf9f45.



Updated run_finch_smoke_tests_android.py to not call recreate_artifacts_dir. Moved the logic into the caller side instead.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Better handle web test artifact directory for Wptrunner"

>

> This reverts commit ec58d5de268b8d8f1e2d2a0bdce6edbb50d40f18.

>

> Reason for revert: This CL removes the recreate_artifacts_dir method

> from WPTResultsProcessor. However that method is still used in the

> finch smoke tests, https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:testing/scripts/run_finch_smoke_tests_android.py;drc=4b45e5af9abc27f7f6c080ff5c9392135c748fe6;l=406.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Better handle web test artifact directory for Wptrunner

> >

> > By default rename layout-test-results to keep previous test results.

> > Add --clobber-old-results to remove old test results, and add an up

> > limit for saved test results.

> >

> > Those are all RWT side behavior, so make change at run_wpt_tests.py side

> > to make them align.

> >

> > Bug: 1426296

> > Change-Id: Ibe647a5eeda08729e3fad2f264887328726d88ed

entry.title: Add DlpRulesManagerBase to chrome/browser/enterprise/data_controls
entry.content:
This is a refactor to add a cross-platform interface for Data Controls

similar to the existing DlpRulesManager, and it makes the current

DlpRulesManager a child class of it. A few notes on this CL:



- The policy namespace is kept to keep the CL simple. Once more files

exist in chrome/browser/chromeos/policy/dlp, this can be

revisited to use no namespace or data_controls depending on needs.

- The new Base interface only hase functions that already existed in

the original CrOS DlpRulesManager.

- DlpRulesManager::Component is CrOS-only for now, so the type and

functions using it are not in the Base interface.



Bug: b/280449704

Change-Id: I735f16cd50c62412b5447bd153dd554a9375fe75

entry.title: Remove unnecessary `state_stack_` pointer checks.
entry.content:
No code path ever writes `nullptr` in the `state_stack_`. Most uses of

the state stack do not check whether pointers are valid. Doing so in

odd places adds noise and confusion as this incorrectly suggests that

state entries can be null.



Change-Id: I774e3e0d3fb3db14fbe3bb4428c5497804993231

entry.title: [omnibox][chrome://omnibox] Extend drag target.
entry.content:
Before this CL, only the 'paste' and 'download' buttons are drag

targets. Dragging a .json file/text onto those 2 buttons would work, but

dragging to anywhere else would either do nothing (when dragging text)

or open the file in a new tab (when dragging a .json).



With this CL, all of the top input section is a drag target. Dragging

anywhere in it will work.



The new chrome download popup covers the 2 buttons on most window sizes

so this CL matters.



Bug: 891303

Change-Id: Ic3d769dac489e27a1bede31954b2c51ae737b9de

entry.title: [SuperSize] ARSC Symbols: Replace "GENERIC" with chunk names.
entry.content:
Our ARSC parser only handles 5 chunk types commonly used in Chrome.

Previously, unhandled chunks were named "GENERIC: type=...".



This CL makes the name less obscure by replacing the above with known

chunk names. So e.g., for RES_TABLE_LIBRARY_TYPE, the name changes from

"GENERIC: type=515" to "LIBRARY". Details:

* Add class ArscGeneric (extends ArscChunk) that takes chunk name on

construction, and echoes that as symbol name.

* _ArscStreamReader.GetArscResTypeToClassMap(): Use local function

MakeGeneric() to create type-dependent ArscGeneric instances for

unhandled chunk types.



Bug: 1064355

Change-Id: I99f12d34779c2ef4c46a9ba834673846e9c82584

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4515476

entry.title: [Tab Switcher] Speculative Fix for Split Screen Grid Card Size
entry.content:
Some Android R devices in portrait split screen have a span count of 3

which is unexpected. This leads to a change in span count when entering

or exiting split-screen while on the tab switcher which can lead to the

brief appearance of tabs overlapping during the transition.



The fact the span count is 3 rather than 2 in portrait split-screen is

a longstanding bug. The easiest fix for that is to use the DP width

based span count used by LFF as what is likely occurring is a

race or reverse sequencing between onConfigurationChanged and the multi

window status updating causing the bug.



The other fix contained in this CL is to trigger a layout update

before updating the grid card sizes so that the grid cards resize after

having enough space rather than before the layout is resized this should

fix the overlap issue, but will not address the span count bug.



Since I do not have a device or emulator that reproduces this issue

I cannot guarantee these fixes will work, but to me these seem like the

only likely solutions.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/features/tab_ui/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/tasks/tab_management/TabListMediator.java;drc=a441f0080fdd428c342175321e9f749dfab74f78;l=1490



Bug: 1443311

Change-Id: Ia8ca01b3955d9b1e62786c0be3ee2587d119300a

entry.title: Lazy load data urls
entry.content:
Lazy loading has some observable effects such as not loading (and

not firing onload) until the image is with the viewport margin. The

spec doesn't special-case data urls so we should not just load them

immediately.



This patch removes the data url special-case added in

https://crrev.com/621758 and skips immediately loading data urls

(see: `CreateResourceForStaticData`) for deferred images in

`ResourceFetcher::RequestResource`.



Bug: 1047909, 1233739

entry.title: Fix a bug that swapped GenerateBid dependency latency metics.
entry.content:
A bug in BidderWorklet::DeliverBidCallbackOnUserThread inadvertently

swapped a pair of the GenerateBidDependencyLatencies. There was test

coverage, but the tests were unfortunately also wrong. As a result,

promises latency was recorded as trusted_signals latency and

trusted_signals latency was recorded as promises latency. This affected

the following metrics:

- MeanGenerateBidTrustedBiddingSignalsLatencyInMillis

- MaxGenerateBidTrustedBiddingSignalsLatencyInMillis

- MeanGenerateBidTrustedBiddingSignalsCriticalPathLatencyInMillis

- NumGenerateBidTrustedBiddingSignalsOnCriticalPath

- MeanGenerateBidConfigPromisesLatencyInMillis

- MaxGenerateBidConfigPromisesLatencyInMillis

- MeanGenerateBidConfigPromisesCriticalPathLatencyInMillis

- NumGenerateBidConfigPromisesOnCriticalPath



To account for the changed meaning of some of these metrics, this change

renames the `AdsInterestGroup.AuctionLatency` metric to `AdsInterestGroup.AuctionLatency.V2`. Any analysis that doesn't use the above metrics can UNION ALL these events together to analyze more data during the rollout of this fix.



Change-Id: Ibe4d98e76dc71e76f343156ce86185f5599d30dc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4509621

Reviewed-by: Sun Yueru

Reviewed-by: Maks Orlovich

Commit-Queue: Orr Bernstein

entry.title: Fix PasswordGenerationControllerImpl::OnAutomaticGenerationAvailable
entry.content:
crash



The crash happens because the check here

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:chrome/browser/password_manager/android/password_generation_controller_impl.cc;l=93;drc=fd3f62c28e3416868f06728ca813d394cfe9b963

started to fail after the CL

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4466290.

The mentioned CL has the side effect that

`OnAutomaticGenerationAvailable` may be now called repeatedly for the

same focused field. I couldn't reproduce the crash, but most probably

what happens is that the repetitive call to `OnAutomaticGenerationAvailable` is received while the password

generation dialog is already shown. There is a check in `ShowDialog`

here https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:chrome/browser/password_manager/android/password_generation_controller_impl.cc;l=219;drc=fd3f62c28e3416868f06728ca813d394cfe9b963,

which guards against calling to show the dialog twice, so I consider the CHECK in the `OnAutomaticGenerationAvailable` excessive.



Bug: 1443471

Change-Id: I17e6c73a57e4a73239862b5da3f715d44b028245

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4514183

Commit-Queue: Anna Tsvirchkova

Reviewed-by: Friedrich Horschig

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1141324}

entry.title: [Sync] Refactor error handling for keystore keys fetching
entry.content:
ModelNeutralState exposes the status of the last attempt to fetch

keystore keys (referred as GetKey or GetEncryptionKey step at layers

around). Before this CL it used SyncerError to reflect the status, but

it doesn't make a lot of sense: it is always either SYNCER_OK or

SERVER_RESPONSE_VALIDATION_FAILED. This CL replaces it with a simple

boolean.



Bug: 1363089

entry.title: Fix flaky PasswordProtection test
entry.content:
This de-flakes the DeferActivatePrerenderStartedAfterRequest test. This

test would occasionally fail as the PasswordProtectionRequest issues a

real request using the SimpleURLLoader. These browser tests expect that

a request won't receive a response (in time?) and mock responses by

manually calling FinishRequest. However, in the flaky runs the URLLoader

receives a real response before the test's mock response and this causes

the CommitDeferringCondition to be destroyed unexpectedly.



This CL adds a bit to PasswordProtectionRequest that allows skipping the

URLLoader request from tests.



Bug: 1433599

Change-Id: Id57f308f114043e321f54a57f9854145dbd56ec5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4509446

Commit-Queue: David Bokan

Reviewed-by: Xinghui Lu

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1141309}

entry.title: [Android] Check no sync completion callback passed on password removal
entry.content:
The sync completion callback passed to RemoveLoginsByURLAndTime is

only relevant for account passwords which don't exist on Android.



This CL clarifies this point by:

1. Adding comments explaining that the callback is used for account

passwords to ensure the passwords are cleared before the user is

signed out (via cookie removal).

2. Checking that on Android, the callback passed in is null since it isn't relevant.



Bug: 1441112

entry.title: Prerender: Add WPTs for prerendering for URLs with fragments
entry.content:
This CL adds WPTs to test and clarify current behavior of speculation-

rules triggered prerendering for URLs with fragments:

- If each URL specified for prerender are not completely identical, it

will be prerendered individually. Therefore, even if some URLs differ

only in fragments, they will be prerendered separately.

- The URL of the activated page should match the prerendering URL so

that they should contain the same fragments.

entry.title: Enable DPD build flag on android-arm64-rel
entry.content:
The Dangling pointer detector is controlled by a binary flag and a

runtime flag:



1. The binary flag enable_dangling_raw_ptr_checks:

This flag controls the size of PartitionAlloc refcount, it

increases from 32 bits to 64 bits. It changes the behavior of

PartitionAlloc when a raw_ptr becomes dangling, calling

PartitionAlloc’s embedder.

This flag requires BackupRefPtr and PartitionAlloc to be enabled to

be effective.

The "helper" build flag "ENABLE_BACKUP_REF_PTR_FEATURE_FLAG" is

used, which defaults the BackupRefPtr feature flag to enabled. This

ensures that every tests on the targeted bots are enabled as it is

impossible to provide feature flags to some binaries.

2. The runtime flag PartitionAllocDanglingPtr:

This flag controls the behavior when a dangling pointer is

detected.

By default the dangling pointer is ignored.



This CL activates the dangling pointer binary flag on

android-arm64-rel. The BRP runtime flag is already enabled on android.



Additional dangling pointer detection documentation available in:

https://crsrc.org/c/docs/dangling_ptr.md



Bug: 1420921

Change-Id: I6ef4f2056d2e6ded48fbbee57dc56fb134768d37

entry.title: Prerender: Store prerendering requests from background pages when the
entry.content:
trigger is speculation rules



Before this CL, any prerendering requests were canceled and never had a

chance to be prerendered if the trigger was in the background at the

time `CreateAndStartHost()` was called.



This CL allows to store prerendering requests(represented as

`PrerenderHost`) from background pages in the `pending_prerenders` queue

and pop/handle them when the pages become foreground on

`StartPrerendering()`.



Since the current implementation only uses `pending_prerenders` queue

when the trigger type is speculation rules, this CL only targets this.

No changes are intended when the trigger is embedder.

entry.title: Pre-paint: Set up properties for missed OOF descendants.
entry.content:
Set up paint properties as correctly as possible for ancestors of a

missed out-of-flow positioned descendant. OOF fragments may be missed

when block-fragmented, when some ancestor between the OOF itself and the

fragmentainer isn't represented in that fragmentainer. Previously we'd

just miss out on all paint properties specified on such ancestors (e.g.

opacity, transforms, clipping).



When setting up paint properties in this mode, side-effects will be

disabled for the ancestors that we're processing - i.e. we'll leave

LayoutObject, PaintLayer and FragmentData alone. We'll just set up the

temporary context objects for pre-paint correctly, so that the missed

descendants get *their* FragmentData objects set up correctly, with

transforms, opacity, etc.



Note that, for now we're skipping this for all clip-related properties.

We need to fix crbug.com/1442211 first, or we risk clipping content that

really should be visible. For other properties like transforms this is

less of an issue. Prior to this change, transforms wouldn't be applied

at all, while, with this CL, they will, although with a potentially

incorrect transform origin. For other properties again, like opacity or

filters, this shortcoming is of no concern at all, since they don't

depend on the offset or size of the fragment (which we currently get

wrong in some cases, due to the bug mentioned).



Added a run-time enabled feature kill-switch, just in case.



Bug: 1371426

entry.title: gfx::ColorTransform: Make SDR white level a runtime parameter
entry.content:
Remove gfx::ColorTransform::Options::sdr_max_luminance_nits and replace

its use with the same variable in RuntimeOptions.



The use of sdr_max_luminance_nits was hard-coded into the steps

ColorTransformHLGFromLinear, ColorTransformPQFromLinear,

ColorTransformHLGToLinear, and ColorTransformPQToLinear. Pull this

out into the separate the ColorTransformNitsToSdrRelative and

ColorTransformSdrToNitsRelative transform steps.



Use the above steps explicitly also when using the transfer function

ColorSpace::TransferID::SCRGB_LINEAR_80_NITS. Previously, that had

been baked into ColorSpace::GetTransferFunction.



Bug: 1442884

Change-Id: I9bce5a4ae5db6e52f2eb66b61f710cb83626aedb

entry.title: Fix potential flakiness in SiteInstanceTest.
entry.content:
While investigating a flaky test, I noticed that both

SiteInstanceTest.CreateForUrlInfo and

SiteInstanceTest.DoesSiteRequireDedicatedProcess didn't clean up the

isolated origins they added (which are stored in global

ChildProcessSecurityPolicy state), potentially causing subseequent

tests to run with stale isolated origins. While this wasn't the root

cause of https://crbug.com/1377466, it could trigger other flakiness

down the road.



To fix this and prevent future mistakes, update the test class to

always clear isolated origins at TearDown(). Remove custom isolated

origin cleanup in other tests since this is now redundant.



Bug: 1377466

entry.title: [FilesBulkPinning] Show tick for folders when bulk pinning syncing
entry.content:
When bulk pinning is enabled all items are downloaded, however, folders

are excluded. This is to ensure items that are updated in the cloud can

first be verified that they can be fit on the disk before actually

pinning them. This leaves folders without the offline tick, even though

their contents are all pinned offline and new contents are made

available offline (same behaviour as pinning).



In this way, this ensures the tick appears on all folders when the bulk

pinning manager is in the syncing state. The existing behaviour should

be retained if the user disables folder syncing (i.e. if a folder is

explicitly pinned it should retain the folder tick, otherwise it should

not have one). Furthermore, shortcuts should are excluded from being

pinned and traversed so they do not receive any special treatment when

the pin manager is enabled.

entry.title: Fix flaky SiteInstanceTest.DoesSiteRequireDedicatedProcess test.
entry.content:
This test was flaky because it adds a custom WebUI scheme via

ContentBrowserClient::GetAdditionalWebUISchemes(), but the test did

not actually see the effect of this due to the caching done by

URLDataManagerBackend::GetWebUISchemes(). So, if some other unit test

ran in the same shard as this test and triggered the caching to happen

sooner (prior to the custom WebUI scheme being added), this test was

seeing the stale list of WebUI schemes when checking it in

SiteInfo::RequiresDedicatedProcess(). This only mattered on Android

since SiteInfo::RequiresDedicatedProcess() returned true sooner on

desktop (from UseDedicatedProcessesForAllSites()).



Ideally, all unit tests should run with this kind of caching

disabled. For now, though, given that there's only one test that

overrides GetAdditionalWebUISchemes(), add some plumbing so that it

disables the caching.

We plan to use import-maps for DevTools web tests in

http/tests/devtools/*. Currently this is very noisy, as content_shell

import-map debug logging.



The log messages not only show up on the terminal

test expectations remain unaffected though.

entry.title: Deflake and restructure navigation queueing tests.
entry.content:
The tests for navigation queueing were a little flaky under load for

subtle reasons: after beginning a renderer-initiated navigation, the

browser test would occasionally report that there was no speculative

RenderFrameHost.



It turns out that there was a subtle race: the browser test utils

provide a helper called `BeginNavigateToURLFromRenderer()`, which is

really just a wrapper around calling `ExecJs("window.location = ...")`.

What would happen during a race is:



1. The `ExecJS()` sends an IPC to execute the given JS snippet in the

current RenderFrameHost, e.g. in the a.com renderer.

2. The a.com renderer calls the `BeginNavigation()` IPC and the browser

process starts a navigation on its behalf.

3. The browser creates a speculative RenderFrameHost, e.g. a b.com

renderer.



At this point, the a.com renderer has not sent a response to the initial

`ExecJS()` request, so the browser is still spinning an event loop

waiting for script execution in the a.com renderer to complete.



However, since the navigation will commit in the b.com renderer, the

navigation started in step 2 and step 3 above can complete *before* the

browser process ever hears about the result of the `ExecJS()` IPC from

the a.com renderer.



The fixes:



`BeginNavigateToURLFromRenderer()` no longer uses `ExecJS()`. Instead,

it uses `ExecuteScriptAsync()` and waits for a `DidStartNavigation()`

for that navigation before returning to the caller.



`BeginNavigationInCommitCallbackInterceptor` no longer exists: it was a

complex layer of nested waits that was quite difficult to understand,

and was very specific to the navigation queueing tests. Instead, it has

been replaced by three smaller and more generic utilities that are also

more composable:



- `CommitNavigationPauser` is a scoper that waits for the renderer to

send `DidCommitProvisionalLoad()` to the browser process, pauses it,

and optionally, allows the paused commit to be resumed.

- `OnNextDidStartNavigation()` is a helper method that executes the

given functor on the next `DidStartNavigation()` in a given

`WebContents`.

- Finally, `ResumeCommitClosureSetWaiter` has been extracted from the

original `BeginNavigationInCommitCallbackInterceptor` and is no longer

responsible for resuming a paused commit , allowing the test logic to

be a bit simpler and easier to read.



The smaller helper utilities also mean that the tests no longer have to

test RunLoops, which can lead to surprising failures and hangs.



Miscellaneous cleanups:



The tests themselves are now called "During" rather than "After" to more

accurately describe the problematic state. Renaming the tests hopefully

has the bonus side effect of having the CQ confirm that the "newly

added" tests are not flaky.



Note that there are still more opportunities for improving the browser

tests to match how such a race condition might play out in production:

one such opportunity would be to pause the IPC::ChannelProxy for a

RenderProcessHost when pausing the navigation commit process. This may

or may not be implemented in the future...

ExternallyManagedAppManager and

ExternallyManagedAppManagerImpl.



During the BMO refactor to rewrite web apps in terms of their own app

database and runtime instead of being built upon Extension apps this

class was split into an interface and Extension specific

implementation details. Once Extension dependencies were shed this

class was renamed but not merged:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1725426

a bit too divergent to easily merge.
